s0001.literal: Emperor Xuan the Filial was Emperor Wu's great-grandson, Crown Prince Li's grandson.
s0001.idiomatic: Emperor Xuan the Filial was Emperor Wu's great-grandson and the grandson of Crown Prince Li.

s0002.literal: The crown prince married Consort Shi, who gave birth to Prince Shi.
s0002.idiomatic: The crown prince married Consort Shi, who bore him Prince Shi.

s0003.literal: Prince Shi married Consort Wang, who gave birth to Emperor Xuan, styled Royal Great-Grandson.
s0003.idiomatic: Prince Shi married Consort Wang, who bore Emperor Xuan, who was styled the Royal Great-Grandson.

s0004.literal: 生數月，遭巫蠱事，太子敗，皇后自殺，皇孫女子皆死。
s0004.idiomatic: Born after several months, he encountered the witchcraft scandal; the crown prince was defeated, the empress committed suicide, and all the prince's daughters died.

s0005.literal: 皇孫年兩歲，隨祖母史良娣居。
s0005.idiomatic: The royal grandson was two years old and lived with his grandmother Consort Shi.

s0006.literal: 時上春秋二十九，乃復奉養於丙殿。
s0006.idiomatic: At this time His Majesty was twenty-nine years old, so he once again raised him in the Bing Hall.

s0007.idiomatic: The great-grandson was ill, and there were several times he nearly did not survive.

s0008.literal: 上於曾孫為人，寬仁谨慎。
s0008.idiomatic: His Majesty, regarding the great-grandson as a person, was broad-minded, benevolent, and cautious.

s0009.literal: 初為帝，數泣言皇曾孫不諱。
s0009.idiomatic: When he first became emperor, he frequently wept saying the royal great-grandson was not to be mentioned.

s0010.literal: 至後月，乃使黃門隨皇曾孫詣崇文館。
s0010.idiomatic: Until the following month, he then sent eunuchs to accompany the royal great-grandson to the Chongwen Library.

s0011.literal: 上幸虎圈斗獸，後宮觀，皇曾孫從。
s0011.idiomatic: His Majesty visited the tiger enclosure to watch beast fighting; the rear palace observed, and the royal great-grandson followed.

s0012.literal: 時皇曾孫年八九歲，召見誦論語、孝經、尚書，或說笑。
s0012.idiomatic: At this time the royal great-grandson was eight or nine years old; when summoned to audience, he recited the Analects, Filial Piety Classic, and Book of Documents, or engaged in conversation and laughter.

s0013.literal: 上嘗歎曰：「祖宗之功德，其覃及胄子哉！」
s0013.idiomatic: His Majesty once sighed and said, 'The merit and virtue of our ancestors extends even to the descendants!'

s0014.literal: 群臣因上書曰：「陛下恩澤甚厚。
s0014.idiomatic: The ministers therefore memorialized, saying: 'Your Majesty's favor and beneficence are exceedingly abundant.

s0015.literal: 此父母之所不及，而陛下於皇曾孫為之。
s0015.idiomatic: This is what even parents cannot achieve, yet Your Majesty does it for the royal great-grandson.

s0016.literal: 群臣無以報効称骨髓，莫如加恩於曾孫。
s0016.idiomatic: We ministers have no way to repay this favor to the marrow of our bones, nothing better than adding favor to the great-grandson.

s0017.literal: 布宣聖德，宣明祖宗之功業於天下。」
s0017.idiomatic: Spread and proclaim the sage virtue, make known the ancestors' achievements to the world.'

s0018.literal: 上於是令有司詔羣臣議皇曾孫為何名。
s0018.idiomatic: His Majesty therefore ordered the officials to decree that the ministers discuss what name the royal great-grandson should have.

s0019.literal: 於是羣臣上書曰：「昔帝堯之世，天下太平，百姓和樂。
s0019.idiomatic: The ministers therefore memorialized, saying: 'In the time of Emperor Yao, the world was peaceful, the people harmonious and happy.

s0020.literal: 此君子之後，有聖人之名。
s0020.idiomatic: This is the descendant of a nobleman, bearing the name of a sage.

s0021.literal: 今皇曾孫體皇族之純血，資文武之精華。
s0021.idiomatic: Now the royal great-grandson embodies the pure blood of the imperial clan, endowed with the essence of civil and martial virtues.

s0022.literal: 受天之祐，宜為皇帝，以紹宗廟，奉祭祀。
s0022.idiomatic: Receiving heaven's blessing, he should become emperor to continue the ancestral temples and conduct the sacrifices.

s0023.idiomatic: We ministers, risking death, present this.'

s0024.literal: 昭帝崩，無嗣，大將軍光與羣臣迎立皇曾孫，歲正月丁亥即皇帝位。
s0024.idiomatic: Emperor Zhao passed away without heirs; the grand marshal Huo Guang and the ministers welcomed and established the royal great-grandson; in the first month of the year, on the day Dinghai, he ascended the imperial throne.

s0025.literal: 謁高廟，尊皇太后為太皇太后。
s0025.idiomatic: He paid respects at the Gao Temple and honored the Empress Dowager as Grand Empress Dowager.

s0026.idiomatic: This year was the first year of Yuanping.

s0027.idiomatic: The Emperor was eighteen years old when he ascended the throne.

s0028.idiomatic: The next year, spring, first month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0029.idiomatic: Granted the people nobility ranks of one level.

s0030.literal: 夏四月，詔曰：「朕以眇身，奉承祖宗，夙夜戰慄，懼弗稱嗣。
s0030.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, receive the legacy of my ancestors; day and night I tremble with fear, afraid of not being worthy of succession.

s0031.literal: 惟百姓未贍，前年減漕，米貴民貧。
s0031.idiomatic: The people are not yet satisfied; last year we reduced the tribute grain, yet grain is expensive and the people are poor.

s0033.literal: 五月，詔曰：「蓋聞古者天子之名，難犯而易避也。
s0033.idiomatic: Fifth month, edict said: 'I have heard that in ancient times the names of the Son of Heaven were difficult to violate but easy to avoid.

s0035.idiomatic: Sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0036.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, Grand Marshal Huo Guang passed away.

s0037.literal: 八月，詔曰：「大將軍光有功于國家，宜以家屬徙茂陵。」
s0037.idiomatic: Eighth month, edict said: 'Grand Marshal Huo Guang had merit for the state; it is appropriate to move his family to Maoling.'

s0040.literal: 二年春正月，詔曰：「朕承宗廟，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不能稱。
s0040.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, edict said: 'I inherit the ancestral temples, fearful and cautious, afraid I cannot be worthy.

s0041.idiomatic: The people are not yet satisfied; I am greatly fearful.

s0042.literal: 惟民之困乏，國家不足以振救。
s0042.idiomatic: The people's destitution—the state is insufficient to provide relief.

s0043.literal: 其令太官損膳，減樂府員，厲精無怠，以助百姓養生。」
s0043.idiomatic: Order the imperial kitchen to reduce meals, reduce the Music Bureau personnel, exert utmost effort without slackening, to help the people sustain life.'

s0044.literal: 二月，詔曰：「朕承先帝之休烈，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不能稱。
s0044.idiomatic: Second month, edict said: 'I inherit my predecessor emperor's blessed achievements, fearful and cautious, afraid I cannot be worthy.

s0045.literal: 惟民之困乏，國家不足以振救。
s0045.idiomatic: The people's destitution—the state is insufficient to provide relief.

s0046.literal: 其令太官損膳，減樂府員，厲精無怠，以助百姓養生。」
s0046.idiomatic: Order the imperial kitchen to reduce meals, reduce the Music Bureau personnel, exert utmost effort without slackening, to help the people sustain life.'

s0047.literal: 三月，詔曰：「蓋聞古者，天子之名，難犯而易避也。
s0047.idiomatic: Third month, edict said: 'I have heard that in ancient times, the names of the Son of Heaven were difficult to violate but easy to avoid.

s0051.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I inherit my predecessor emperor's blessed achievements, fearful and cautious, afraid I cannot be worthy.

s0056.idiomatic: Third year, spring, first month, edict said: 'I inherit my predecessor emperor's blessed achievements, fearful and cautious, afraid I cannot be worthy.
